item.title: Copayment insight
item.description: My Insight Copayment in Thailand is a game-changer for expats and locals buying private insurance. It’s a practical way to keep premiums down—vital in a country where private healthcare is world-class but pricey (e.g., a Bangkok hospital MRI might cost ฿20,000+). However, it’s a double-edged sword: a 20% copay on a ฿500,000 cancer treatment is ฿100,000 out of pocket, which could hit hard. If you’re considering it, weigh your health needs and financial cushion. For expats, pairing a copay plan with Thailand’s excellent public system (if eligible via work) might be a smart hybrid approach.

item.title: Crypto King’s X Prediction Ignites Firestorm: $1M Bitcoin by 2030?

Kafaak’s Tweet Sparks Debate on Tech Trends

In a recent tweet, @Kafaak, a well-known tech influencer, sparked a conversation about the latest social media trends. The tweet, which read:

“The future of social media is all about authentic connections over algorithmic engagement. #TechTrends”

has generated thousands of replies, with users discussing the shift from engagement metrics to real relationships in the online world.

This tweet comes at a time when users are questioning social media algorithms. In a world dominated by likes and shares, many are wondering if authentic engagement could be the new measure of success.
